instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message: I have a 820-3437-B works fine except when adjusting the backlight brightness it jumps from one brightness setting to the next. Its jerky/choppy vs being a smooth transition. I replaced the backlight chip and no change.

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message:
Can you upload a video?
I don't exactly understand what is the problem...

Did you try PRAM reset?

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message: Pram reset didnt do anything. its not too noticable but when holding the brighness up or down button its not as smooth as it should be not too much of a problem but just wondering. Its not letting me upload a gif its saying too large its around 3.7MB

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message:
I don't think this to be a problem.
Nobody "plays" with backlight keys more than few seconds in a month.
Don't worry, if machine passes all tests.

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message: Ok just had another board like this a while back was just curious Thanks

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message: I think it depends which version of LP8550 you use. I had a strip where all of them were like that.. can't remember which type it was.

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message: Which ones do you use right now that work properly?

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message:
They are these ones: [URL]http://www.mouser.com/ProductDetail/texas-instruments/lp8550tle-nopb/?qs=8uBHJDVwVqyaGsB1UwIBAw%3d%3d&countrycode=DE¤cycode=EUR[/URL]
So TLE at the end

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message: Yeah it's your LP8550. It's annoying, but not a "problem". Just not as smooth and buttery.

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message:
Boot a Linux LiveUSB (macOS won't work for that), install python3-smbus and run this script with sudo: [URL]https://gist.github.com/piernov/c2891eebf328491ff7cad20ddab7077b[/URL]
Hopefully fixes the issue.

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message: haha. is this to write new slope settings in the LP8550? Sweet man..

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message:
Quick update: I ordered 40x LP8550 from the mouser link above, and they still have the choppy-adjustment. So, I'd avoid buying from there if you were considering. 

Haven't tried the python script fix yet, not sure how, but the mouser part isn't a fix.

threads.title: 820-3437-B Choppy Backlight adjustment
threads.message: strange. guess they have different baked in settings than the ones i have. they came from the same link.
